meanings.definition: The action of arranging items at regular intervals.
meanings.sent1: The spacing of the chairs in the classroom was perfect for the students to move around easily.
meanings.sent2: The spacing between the trees in the garden allowed just enough sunlight to filter through.
meanings.sent3: The spacing of the cookies on the baking sheet was so precise, it looked like a delicious grid.
meanings.sent4: The spacing of the stars in the night sky seemed to create a magical pattern above us.
meanings.sent5: The spacing of the books on the shelf made it easy to find the one I was looking for.

meanings.definition: The amount of space between two objects or points.
meanings.sent1: The spacing between the houses in the neighborhood was quite generous.
meanings.sent2: The proper spacing between the words on the page made the text easy to read.
meanings.sent3: The spacing between the raindrops seemed to increase as the storm grew stronger.
meanings.sent4: The spacing between the beats of the music created a sense of anticipation.
meanings.sent5: The spacing between the cars in traffic allowed for smooth merging onto the highway.

meanings.definition: The process of creating gaps or intervals between elements.
meanings.sent1: The spacing of the fence posts was done meticulously to ensure stability.
meanings.sent2: The spacing between the flowers in the garden added a sense of depth to the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The spacing of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to figure out where each one fit.
meanings.sent4: The spacing between the lines in the notebook gave room for neat handwriting.
meanings.sent5: The spacing between the clouds allowed glimpses of the blue sky to peek through.
